org.openimaj.audio.samples

Interface SampleBuffer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<Float>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FloatSampleBuffer, SampleBuffer16Bit, SampleBuffer8Bit

    public interface SampleBuffer
extends Iterable<Float>
    This class provides a consistent API for access samples of different sizes (e.g. 8-bit and 16-bit). Subclasses implement get and set methods for samples in a sample byte buffer. The getters and setters return and take floats in all cases, so it is up to the implementing class to decide how best to convert the incoming value to an appropriate value for the sample buffer. The values given and expected should be normalised between Integer.MAX_VALUE and Integer.MIN_VALUE. Despite using floats, this allows us to detect clipping. Return values are signed such that an empty signal has sample value 0. If the audio has multiple channels they will occur in the same order as the original file (likely to be multiplexed - so get(0) will be channel 1 and get(1) will be channel 2, etc.).
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double[] asDoubleArray()
      Returns the normalised (0..1) sample buffer data as a double array.
      double[][] asDoubleChannelArray()
      Returns the samples in their channels as normalise (0..1) sample buffer data.
      float get(int index)
      Get the sample at the given index.
      AudioFormat getFormat()
      Returns the audio format for this set of samples.

      Return a sample chunk that contains the data from this sample buffer.

      Return a sample chunk that contains the data from a specific channel in this sample buffer.

      Returns the timecode of the start of this sample buffer.

      Returns the sample value at the given index without scaling - that is, at it's original sample value.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        iterator

    • Method Detail

      • get

        float get(int index)
        Get the sample at the given index. The sample will be a float and have a value between Integer.MAX_VALUE and Integer.MIN_VALUE. That sample will be signed.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the sample to retrieve
        Returns:
        The sample value as an float

      • set

        void set(int index,
       float sample)
        Set the sample value at the given index. The sample value should be scaled between Integer.MAX_VALUE and Integer.MIN_VALUE (i.e. it should be signed).
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the sample to set.
        sample - The sample value to set.

      • size

        int size()
        Returns the size of this buffer. Divide by the number of channels to get the number of samples per channel.
        Returns:
        the size of this buffer.

      • getFormat

        AudioFormat getFormat()
        Returns the audio format for this set of samples.
        Returns:
        The AudioFormat for this set of samples.

      • setFormat

        void setFormat(AudioFormat af)
        Reset the audio format for the samples in this buffer.
        Parameters:
        af - The AudioFormat

      • getSampleChunk

        SampleChunk getSampleChunk()
        Return a sample chunk that contains the data from this sample buffer. Note that any timestamps will be unset in the new sample chunk.
        Returns:
        A SampleChunk containing data in this buffer.

      • getSampleChunk

        SampleChunk getSampleChunk(int channel)
        Return a sample chunk that contains the data from a specific channel in this sample buffer. The channel is numbered from 0 (so mono audio streams will only have 1 channel accessed with getSampleChunk(0)). Note that any timestamps will be unset in the new sample chunk.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel
        Returns:
        A SampleChunk containing data in this buffer.

      • asDoubleArray

        double[] asDoubleArray()
        Returns the normalised (0..1) sample buffer data as a double array.
        Returns:
        A double array containing the normalised samples

      • asDoubleChannelArray

        double[][] asDoubleChannelArray()
        Returns the samples in their channels as normalise (0..1) sample buffer data.
        Returns:
        The array where the first dimension is the channels.

      • getUnscaled

        float getUnscaled(int index)
        Returns the sample value at the given index without scaling - that is, at it's original sample value. This can be useful for debugging, or if the sample buffer is being used for non-audio applications.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to retrieve
        Returns:
        The value unscaled

      • getStartTimecode

        AudioTimecode getStartTimecode()
        Returns the timecode of the start of this sample buffer. May return null if the timecode is unknown or has no meaning in this context.
        Returns:
        The timecode a the start of this buffer.
